sen.j: 大彦命（おおびこのみこと、生没年不詳）は古代日本の皇族。
sen.e: Obiko no Mikoto (date of birth and death unknown) was a member of the Imperial Family.
sen.cmt: 原文は「日本の皇族（王族）」となっていましたがWeb表記にあわせて「古代日本の皇族」としました。
sen.e: Obiko no Mikoto (date of birth and death unknown) was a member of the Imperial Family.
Obiko no Mikoto (year of birth and death unknown) was a member of the Imperial Family.

sen.j: 大毘古命。
sen.e: Kanji characters for "Obiko no Mikoto" are 大彦命 or 大毘古命.
sen.cmt: 漢字表記をのこしました。
sen.e: Kanji characters for "Obiko no Mikoto" are 大彦命 or 大毘古命.
Kanji characters for "Obiko no Mikoto" are 大彦命 or 大毘古命.

sen.j: 孝元天皇の第一皇子で、母は皇后・鬱色謎命（うつしこめのみこと）。
sen.e: Obiko no Mikoto was the first prince of the Emperor Kogen, and his birth mother was the Empress Utsushikome no Mikoto.
Obiko no Mikoto was the first prince of the Emperor Kogen, and his birth mother was the Empress Utsushikome no Mikoto.
Obiko no Mikoto was the first prince of the Emperor Kogen, and his birth mother was the Empress Utsushikome no Mikoto.

sen.j: 開化天皇と少彦男心命（古事記では少名日子名建猪心命）の同母兄で、垂仁天皇の外祖父に当たる。
sen.e: He was a brother of the Emperor Kaika and Sukunahikowokokoro no Mikoto (or in "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) he was called Sukunahikotakeikokoro no Mikoto) with the same mother, and maternal grandfather of the Emperor Suinin.

He was a brother of the Emperor Kaika and Sukunahikowokokoro no Mikoto (or in "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) he was called Sukunahikotakeikokoro no Mikoto) with the same mother, and maternal grandfather of the Emperor Suinin.

He was a older brother of the Emperor Kaika and Sukunahikowokokoro no Mikoto (or in "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) he was called Sukunahikotakeikokoro no Mikoto, and maternal grandfather of the Emperor Suinin.

sen.j: 北陸道を主に制圧した四道将軍の一人。
sen.e: He was one of Shido-shogun (Generals Dispatched to Four Circuits) who pacified mainly Hokurikudo.
He was one of Shido-shogun (Generals Dispatched to Four Circuits) who mainly pacified Hokurikudo.
He was one of Shido-shogun (Generals Dispatched to Four Circuits) who mainly pacified Hokurikudo.

sen.j: 神話での記述
sen.e: Descriptions in the Mythology
Descriptions in the Mythology
Descriptions in the mythology

sen.j: 記紀によれば、崇神天皇の詔により四道将軍の一人として北陸地方に派遣され、越国の土着の豪族たちを平定し大和朝廷の基礎を築いた。
sen.e: According to the Kojiki and Nihonshoki, Obiko no Mikoto was dispatched as one of Shido-shogun to the Hokuriku region by the Emperor Suijin's decree, pacified the local powerful clan of Koshi Province and built the foundation of the Yamato Dynasty.

According to the Kojiki and Nihonshoki, Obiko no Mikoto was dispatched as one of Shido-shogun to the Hokuriku region by the Emperor Suijin's decree, pacified the powerful local clan of Koshi Province and built the foundation of the Yamato Dynasty.

According to the Kojiki (Records of Ancient Matters) and the Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan), Obiko no Mikoto was dispatched as one of Shido-shogun to the Hokuriku region by the Emperor Suijin's decree, pacified the powerful local clan of Koshi Province and built the foundation of the Yamato Dynasty.

sen.j: またこの出陣の道中、大彦は不吉な詩を歌う不思議な少女に会ったので、引き返してこのことを報告した。
sen.e: On his way to the battle, Obiko met a mysterious girl singing a ominous song, so he returned to report this encounter.
On his way to the battle, Obiko met a mysterious girl singing an ominous song, so he returned to report this encounter.
On his way to the battle, Obiko met a mysterious girl singing an ominous song, so he returned to report this encounter.

sen.j: 倭迹迹日百襲媛命に占わせると、武埴安彦命とその妻吾田媛の謀反を告げるものだった。
sen.e: He asked Yamatototohimomosohime no Mikoto to do divination, and she said that it was an omen of a rebellion by Takehaniyasuhiko no Mikoto and his wife Ata hime.
He asked Yamatototohimomosohime no Mikoto to do divination, and she said that it was an omen of a rebellion by Takehaniyasuhiko no Mikoto and his wife Ata hime.
He asked Yamatototohimomosohime no Mikoto to do divination, and she said that it was an omen of a rebellion by Takehaniyasuhiko no Mikoto and his wife Ata hime.

sen.j: 果たして謀反が起こったが、大彦は彦国葺と共に武埴安彦を討ちとり、吾田媛は吉備津彦命が討ってこれを鎮圧したという。
sen.e: In fact, the rebellion occurred, but Obiko and Hikokunibuku slew Takehaniyasuhiko while Kibitsuhiko no mikoto killed Ata hime to suppress the rebellion.
In fact, the rebellion occurred, but Obiko and Hikokunibuku slew Takehaniyasuhiko while Kibitsuhiko no mikoto killed Ata hime to suppress the rebellion.
In fact, the rebellion occurred, but Obiko and Hikokunibuku slew Takehaniyasuhiko while Kibitsuhiko no mikoto killed Ata hime to suppress the rebellion.

sen.j: また『古事記』によれば、北陸平定後、四道将軍の一人で東海地方を平定した子の武渟川別と合流した場所が会津である。
sen.e: In addition, according to the "Kojiki," after he pacified Hokuriku region, Obiko met his son Takenuna kawawake, who was another Shido-shogun and pacified Tokai region, in Aizu.
In addition, according to the "Kojiki," after he pacified Hokuriku region, Obiko met his son Takenuna kawawake, who was another Shido-shogun and pacified Tokai region, in Aizu.
In addition, according to the "Kojiki," after he pacified Hokuriku region, Obiko met his son Takenuna kawawake, who was another Shido-shogun and pacified Tokai region, in Aizu.

sen.j: （会津地名の由来）
sen.e: (The name of Aizu came from this episode.)
(The name of Aizu came from this episode.)
(The name of Aizu came from this episode.)

sen.j: 大彦命の後裔
sen.e: Descendants of Obiko no Mikoto
Descendants of Obiko no Mikoto
Descendants of Obiko no Mikoto

sen.j: 阿倍氏を始め、那須国造・筑紫国国造・膳臣・佐々貴山君・伊賀国臣・越国国造・難波吉士など諸氏族の祖と伝えられる。
sen.e: Obiko no Mikoto is believed to be the founder of several clans including Abe, Nasunokuni no miyatsuko, Tsukushinokuni no miyatsuko, Kashiwade no omi, Sasakiyamagimi, Igano kuniomi, Koshinokuni no miyatsuko, and Naniwa no kishi.

Obiko no Mikoto is believed to be the founder of several clans including Abe, Nasunokuni no miyatsuko, Tsukushinokuni no miyatsuko, Kashiwade no omi, Sasakiyamagimi, Igano kuniomi, Koshinokuni no miyatsuko, and Naniwa no kishi.

Obiko no Mikoto is believed to be the founder of several clans including Abe, Nasunokuni no miyatsuko, Tsukushinokuni no miyatsuko, Kashiwade no omi, Sasakiyamagimi, Igano kuniomi, Koshinokuni no miyatsuko, and Naniwa no kishi.

sen.j: なお、埼玉県の稲荷山古墳から発掘された金錯銘鉄剣に見える乎獲居臣の上祖・意冨比垝（おほびこ）と同一人である可能性が高い。
sen.e: There is a high possibility that Obiko no Mikoto is identical with Ohobiko, an ancestor of Owake no omi and whose name is inscribed on the kinsakumei tekken (an iron sword with gold-inlaid inscriptions) that was excavated from the Inariyama-kofun Tumulus in Saitama Prefecture.

There is a high possibility that Obiko no Mikoto is identical to Ohobiko, an ancestor of Owake no omi and whose name is inscribed on the kinsakumei tekken (an iron sword with gold-inlaid inscriptions) that was excavated from the Inariyama-kofun Tumulus in Saitama Prefecture.

There is a high possibility that Obiko no Mikoto is identical to Ohobiko, an ancestor of Owake no omi and whose name is inscribed on the kinsakumei tekken (an iron sword with gold-inlaid inscriptions) that was excavated from the Inariyama-kofun Tumulus in Saitama Prefecture.

sen.j: この場合、乎獲居臣を阿倍氏・膳氏とする解釈が多い。
sen.e: If two were the same person, many interpret that Owake no omi was the Abe or Kashiwade clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: If the two were the same person, many interpret that Owake no omi was the Abe or Kashiwade clan.
If the two were the same person, many interpret that Owake no omi was the Abe or Kashiwade clan.

sen.j: しかし、その後の時代、北武蔵で大きな勢力を築いていた壬生吉士(難波吉士と同族)の可能性もある。
sen.e: There is another possibility, however, that Owake no omi was Mibu no kishi (the same clan as Naniwa no kishi) that were very influential in north Musashi Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: There is another possibility, however, that Owake no omi was Mibu no kishi (the same clan as Naniwa no kishi) that was very influential in north Musashi Province.
There is another possibility, however, that Owake no omi was Mibu no kishi (the same clan as Naniwa no kishi) that was very influential in north Musashi Province later years.

sen.j: 系譜についての異説
sen.e: Heresy of Genealogy
Heresy of Genealogy
Heresy of genealogy

sen.j: 大彦は、崇神の皇后御真津姫の父と記されているが、古事記の崇神の条には、崇神が大彦の叔父と読める部分がある。
sen.e: Obiko was described as the father of Mimatsu hime, the empress of Sujin; in the section of Suijin in the Kojiki, however, there is a description that can be interpreted that Suijin was Obiko's uncle.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Obiko was described as the father of Mimatsu hime, the empress of Sujin; in the section of Suijin in the Kojiki, however, there is a description that can be interpreted that Suijin was Obiko's uncle.
Obiko was described as the father of Mimatsu hime, the empress of Sujin; in the section of Suijin in the Kojiki, however, there is a description that can be interpreted that Suijin was Obiko's uncle.

sen.j: このことから、記紀系譜に対する疑問を呈した異説がある。
sen.e: Based on this description, there is a heresy that questions the genealogy in the Kojiki and Nihonshoki.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Based on this description, there is a heretical explanation that questions the genealogy in the Kojiki and Nihonshoki.
Based on this description, there is a heretical explanation that questions the genealogy in the Kojiki and Nihonshoki.

sen.j: その説によると、景行紀53年に登場する大彦の孫磐鹿六雁の存在、あるいは埼玉稲荷山古墳出土の鉄剣銘文に記された系譜の代数から示される。
sen.e: This theory is based on the following evidences: 1) Obiko's grandson Iwakamutsukari appears in the year of 53 in Keiko tenno ki (Records of Emperor Keiko); 2) D49the number of generations inscribed on the iron sword excavated from the Inariyama-kofun Tumulus in Saitama Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This theory is based on the following evidence: 1) Obiko's grandson Iwakamutsukari appears in the year of 53 in Keiko tenno ki (Records of Emperor Keiko); 2) D49the number of generations inscribed on the iron sword excavated from the Inariyama-kofun Tumulus in Saitama Prefecture.

This theory is based on the following evidence: 1) Obiko's grandson Iwakamutsukari appears in the year of 53 in Keiko tenno ki (Records of Emperor Keiko); 2) the number of generations inscribed on the iron sword excavated from the Inariyama-kofun Tumulus in Saitama Prefecture.

sen.j: 大彦の活躍した時代は3世紀末から4世紀初頭と推定され、崇神より一世代後と考えるのが妥当である。
sen.e: These facts indicate that Obiko lived from the late third century to early fourth century, the period that was one generation after the Emperor Suijin.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: These facts indicate that Obiko lived from the late third century to early fourth century, a period that was one generation after the Emperor Suijin.
These facts indicate that Obiko lived from the late third century to early fourth century, a period that was one generation after the Emperor Suijin.

sen.j: その一世代後、すなわち垂仁の条には、沙本毘古の乱が記されているが、それと大彦の関係した武埴安彦の乱とは地域の重なりなど類似性が高い。
sen.e: The record of one generation after that, or the era of Emperor Suinin, described the rebellion of Sahobiko that showed numerous similarities, such as the region of occurrence, with the rebellion of Takehaniyasuhiko in which Obiko was involved.

One generation after that, or during the era of Emperor Suinin, described the rebellion of Sahobiko that showed numerous similarities, such as the region of occurrence, with the rebellion of Takehaniyasuhiko in which Obiko was involved.

One generation after that, or during the era of Emperor Suinin, described the rebellion of Sahobiko that showed numerous similarities, such as the region of occurrence, with the rebellion of Takehaniyasuhiko in which Obiko was involved.

sen.j: 大彦の父とされる孝元については、武内宿禰（成務と同じ日に生まれたとされる）の祖父あるいは曽祖父とされる。
sen.e: The Emperor Kogen who is said to be the father of Obiko is also believed to be the grandfather of great-grandfather of TAKENOUCHI no Sukune who was said to be born on the same day as the Emperor Seimu.

The Emperor Kogen who is said to be the father of Obiko is also believed to be the grandfather of great-grandfather of TAKENOUCHI no Sukune who was said to be born on the same day as the Emperor Seimu.

The Emperor Kogen who is said to be the father of Obiko is also believed to be the grandfather or great-grandfather of TAKENOUCHI no Sukune who was said to be born on the same day as the Emperor Seimu.

sen.j: このことも、大彦が垂仁の時代の人物である可能性の高いことを示している。
sen.e: This fact also indicates the high possibility that Obiko lived in the era of the Emperor Suijin.
This fact also indicates the high possibility that Obiko lived in the era of the Emperor Suijin.
This fact also indicates the high possibility that Obiko lived in the era of the Emperor Suijin.

sen.j: 大彦の娘で崇神の皇后とされる御真津姫は、古事記に崇神の姉妹とも記載されている。
sen.e: Obiko's daughter Mimatsu hime who was the empress of Sujin was also described in the Kojiki as Suijin's sister.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Obiko's daughter Mimatsu hime who was the empress of Sujin was also described in the Kojiki as Suijin's sister.
Obiko's daughter Mimatsu hime who was the empress of Sujin was also described in the Kojiki as Suijin's sister.

sen.j: この部分の系譜は信憑性に疑問がある。
sen.e: The credibility of this part of genealogy is questionable.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The credibility of this part of the genealogy is questionable.
The credibility of this part of the genealogy is questionable.
